Methods

GeBudgetItemsByCategory(Nullable<DateTime>, Nullable<DateTime>, Boolean, Int32)

Gets Budget items by category by first getting the budget items, grouping them by category, determining the total and creating a new object with the info. This is possible by using the method GetBudgetItems(Nullable<DateTime>, Nullable<DateTime>, Boolean, Int32) first, then grouping all the items according to their category, finding the total for each item in the list according to the amount and creating a BudgetItemsByCategory object for each item to add in the summary which will be returned in the end.

Declaration
public List<BudgetItemsByCategory> GeBudgetItemsByCategory(DateTime? Start, DateTime? End, bool FilterFlag, int CategoryID)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Nullable<System.DateTime> Start

Start of datetime where the list would begin.
System.Nullable<System.DateTime> End

End of datetime where the list would end.
System.Boolean FilterFlag

filter outs unwanted categories if it is true.
System.Int32 CategoryID

Id number of the category.
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.List<BudgetItemsByCategory>

list of BudgetItems explaining the summary.
Examples

For all examples below, assume the budget file contains the following elements:

Cat_ID  Expense_ID  Date                    Description                    Cost
   10       1       1/10/2018 12:00:00 AM   Clothes hat (on credit)         10
    9       2       1/11/2018 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card hat                -10
   10       3       1/10/2019 12:00:00 AM   Clothes scarf(on credit)        15
    9       4       1/10/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card scarf              -15
   14       5       1/11/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out McDonalds            45
   14       7       1/12/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Wendys               25
   14      10       2/1/2020 12:00:00 AM    Eating Out Pizza                33.33
    9      13       2/10/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card mittens            -15
    9      12       2/25/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card Hat                -25
   14      11       2/27/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Pizza                33.33
   14       9       7/11/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Cafeteria            11.11

Getting a list of budget items by CATEGORY

 HomeBudget budget = new HomeBudget();

//Reads from the budget file.
 budget.ReadFromFile(filename);

//Get a list of all budget items
 var budgetItems = budget.GetBudgetItemsByCategory(null, null, false, 0);

//print important information
foreach (var bi in budgetItems)
   {
     Console.WriteLine(
        String.Format("{0} {1,-20}  {2,8:C}", 
            bi.Category.ToString(),
             bi.Details[0].Date,
             bi.Total)
      );
}

Sample output containing the category, date of the first item in details and total:

Clothes 2018-01-10 12:00:00 AM   -$25.00
Credit Card 2018-01-11 12:00:00 AM    $65.00
Eating Out 2020-01-11 12:00:00 AM  -$147.77

GetBudgetDictionaryByCategoryAndMonth(Nullable<DateTime>, Nullable<DateTime>, Boolean, Int32)

Gets the budget dictionary by category and month by getting a list of budget items by month, looping over each month and then looping over each category, and determining the total for each category. This method is used for combining th information of Category and Month budget items with dictionaries.

Declaration
public List<Dictionary<string, object>> GetBudgetDictionaryByCategoryAndMonth(DateTime? Start, DateTime? End, bool FilterFlag, int CategoryID)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Nullable<System.DateTime> Start

Start of datetime where the list would begin.
System.Nullable<System.DateTime> End

End of datetime where the list would end.
System.Boolean FilterFlag

filter outs unwanted categories if it is true.
System.Int32 CategoryID

Id number of the category.
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<System.String, System.Object>>

list of dictionaries explaining the summary.
Examples

For all examples below, assume the budget file contains the following elements:

Cat_ID  Expense_ID  Date                    Description                    Cost
   10       1       1/10/2018 12:00:00 AM   Clothes hat (on credit)         10
    9       2       1/11/2018 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card hat                -10
   10       3       1/10/2019 12:00:00 AM   Clothes scarf(on credit)        15
    9       4       1/10/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card scarf              -15
   14       5       1/11/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out McDonalds            45
   14       7       1/12/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Wendys               25
   14      10       2/1/2020 12:00:00 AM    Eating Out Pizza                33.33
    9      13       2/10/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card mittens            -15
    9      12       2/25/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card Hat                -25
   14      11       2/27/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Pizza                33.33
   14       9       7/11/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Cafeteria            11.11

Getting a list of budget items by CATEGORY and MONTH

 HomeBudget budget = new HomeBudget();

//Reads from the budget file.
 budget.ReadFromFile(filename);

//Get a list of all budget items
 var budgetItems = budget.GetBudgetItemsByCategory(null, null, false, 0);

GetBudgetItems(Nullable<DateTime>, Nullable<DateTime>, Boolean, Int32)

Gets Budget items by querying a list of categories and expenses within the start and end datetime, finding the total costs and returning the items. This is possible by creating a combined list of expenses and categories with the List() and List() methods within the datetime received, finding the total which is represented as the balance after every item on the list, and finally returning the items. This method is used for getting a list of items within a certain time in order of datetime while keeping track of the balance (total).

Declaration
public List<BudgetItem> GetBudgetItems(DateTime? Start, DateTime? End, bool FilterFlag, int CategoryID)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Nullable<System.DateTime> Start

Start of datetime where the list would begin.
System.Nullable<System.DateTime> End

End of datetime where the list would end.
System.Boolean FilterFlag

filter outs unwanted categories if it is true.
System.Int32 CategoryID

Id number of the category.
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.List<BudgetItem>

list of BudgetItems.
Examples

For all examples below, assume the budget file contains the following elements:

Cat_ID  Expense_ID  Date                    Description                    Cost
   10       1       1/10/2018 12:00:00 AM   Clothes hat (on credit)         10
    9       2       1/11/2018 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card hat                -10
   10       3       1/10/2019 12:00:00 AM   Clothes scarf(on credit)        15
    9       4       1/10/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card scarf              -15
   14       5       1/11/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out McDonalds            45
   14       7       1/12/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Wendys               25
   14      10       2/1/2020 12:00:00 AM    Eating Out Pizza                33.33
    9      13       2/10/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card mittens            -15
    9      12       2/25/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card Hat                -25
   14      11       2/27/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Pizza                33.33
   14       9       7/11/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Cafeteria            11.11

Getting a list of ALL budget items.

 HomeBudget budget = new HomeBudget();

//Reads from the budget file.
 budget.ReadFromFile(filename);

 // Get a list of all budget items
 var budgetItems = budget.GetBudgetItems(null, null, false, 0);

 // print important information
 foreach (var bi in budgetItems)
 {
     Console.WRiteLine ( 
         String.Format("{0} {1,-20}  {2,8:C} {3,12:C}", 
            bi.Date.ToString("yyyy/MMM/dd"),
            bi.ShortDescription,
            bi.Amount, bi.Balance)
      );
 }

Sample output containing the date, description, amount and balance: The list is sorted by datetime unlike before.

2018-Jan-10 hat (on credit)        -$10.00      -$10.00
2018-Jan-11 hat                     $10.00        $0.00
2019-Jan-10 scarf(on credit)      -$15.00      -$15.00
2020-Jan-10 scarf                   $15.00        $0.00
2020-Jan-11 McDonalds              -$45.00      -$45.00
2020-Jan-12 Wendys                 -$25.00      -$70.00
2020-Feb-01 Pizza                  -$33.33     -$103.33
2020-Feb-10 mittens                 $15.00      -$88.33
2020-Feb-25 Hat                     $25.00      -$63.33
2020-Feb-27 Pizza                  -$33.33      -$96.66
2020-Jul-11 Cafeteria              -$11.11     -$107.77

GetBudgetItemsByMonth(Nullable<DateTime>, Nullable<DateTime>, Boolean, Int32)

Gets Budget items by month by first getting the budget items, grouping them by month, determining the total and creating a new object with the info. This is possible by using the method GetBudgetItems(Nullable<DateTime>, Nullable<DateTime>, Boolean, Int32) first, then grouping all the items according to their month and year, finding the total for each item in the list according to the amount and creating a BudgetItemsByMonth object for each item to add in the summary which will be returned in the end.

Declaration
public List<BudgetItemsByMonth> GetBudgetItemsByMonth(DateTime? Start, DateTime? End, bool FilterFlag, int CategoryID)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Nullable<System.DateTime> Start

Start of datetime where the list would begin.
System.Nullable<System.DateTime> End

End of datetime where the list would end.
System.Boolean FilterFlag

filter outs unwanted categories if it is true.
System.Int32 CategoryID

Id number of the category.
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.List<BudgetItemsByMonth>

list of BudgetItems explaining the summary.
Examples

For all examples below, assume the budget file contains the following elements:

Cat_ID  Expense_ID  Date                    Description                    Cost
   10       1       1/10/2018 12:00:00 AM   Clothes hat (on credit)         10
    9       2       1/11/2018 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card hat                -10
   10       3       1/10/2019 12:00:00 AM   Clothes scarf(on credit)        15
    9       4       1/10/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card scarf              -15
   14       5       1/11/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out McDonalds            45
   14       7       1/12/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Wendys               25
   14      10       2/1/2020 12:00:00 AM    Eating Out Pizza                33.33
    9      13       2/10/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card mittens            -15
    9      12       2/25/2020 12:00:00 AM   Credit Card Hat                -25
   14      11       2/27/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Pizza                33.33
   14       9       7/11/2020 12:00:00 AM   Eating Out Cafeteria            11.11

Getting a list of budget items by MONTH.

 HomeBudget budget = new HomeBudget();

//Reads from the budget file.
 budget.ReadFromFile(filename);

//Get a list of all budget items
 var budgetItems = budget.GetBudgetItemsByMonth(null, null, false, 0);

//print important information
foreach (var bi in budgetItems)
   {
     Console.WriteLine(
        String.Format("{0} {1,-20}  {2,8:C}", 
            bi.Month.ToString(),
             bi.Details[0].Category,
             bi.Total)
      );
}

Sample output containing the date, category of the first item in details and total: The list is sorted by datetime unlike before.

2018/01 Clothes                  $0.00
2019/01 Clothes                -$15.00
2020/01 Credit Card            -$55.00
2020/02 Eating Out             -$26.66
2020/07 Eating Out             -$11.11

ReadFromFile(String)

Reads from a file if it exists and stores the information from the files to the Categories and Expenses lists. This is possible by veryfing the existence of the file with the VerifyReadFromFileName(String, String) method, reading the file, getting the path of the filenames, and reading from the file with the ReadFromFile(String) method and ReadFromFile(String) method. This method also saves the directory and file name for later usage.

Declaration
public void ReadFromFile(string budgetFileName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String budgetFileName

File name that will be read from
Examples

For all examples below, assume the budgetFileName contains the following elements:

test_categories.cats
test_expenses.exps

Reading from the BugdetFileName

HomeBudget budget = new HomeBudget();

//Reads from filename which has the two file namess
budget.ReadFromFile(filename);
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.Exception

Thrown when there was an error reading the budget info
System.IO.FileNotFoundException

Thrown when file path does not exist. Exception thrown in VerifyReadFromFileName(String, String) method.
System.Exception

thrown when there was an error reading from the XML file. Exception thrown in ReadFromFile(String) and ReadFromFile(String).

SaveToFile(String)

Writes to a file if it exists, constructs file names for expenses and categories, saves categories and expenses list to a file each and saves the files to the budget file. This is possible by verifying if you can write to the file with the VerifyWriteToFileName(String, String) method, creating file names for expenses and categories in the filepath, saving the files to those filepaths with the SaveToFile(String) and SaveToFile(String) methods and writing the file names in the budget file. This method also saves the directory and file name for later usage.

Declaration
public void SaveToFile(string filepath)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String filepath

File path for budget file.
Examples
HomeBudget budget = new HomeBudget();

//Saves expenses and categories filenames in budget file.
budget.SaveToFile(filename);
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.Exception

Thrown when filepath does not exist or when filepath is read-only meaning that you cannot write in the file. Thrown in VerifyWriteToFileName(String, String) method.
